text: (upbeat music)
- To succeed as a solution architect,

one of the main things
you need is the passion
to learn and passion for technology,
because technology changes all the time.
- So in terms of skills that you need
for solution architect,

I feel like it's already
a bit in the word, right?
We build solutions.
So for me, it's all about problem solving.
I think every day is a new day.
You'd never know what's coming.

- The people I work with, they
have that innovative spirit,

the drive to learn new things
and try out new things,
and really great environment to work with.

- My honest favorite part
about the role is the people.
At first, it can be a bit scary,
because you're around a lot of people
that know a lot of things.
And slowly but surely,
you realize that you are one of the people
that know a lot of things, too.
- So what I like most about working in AWS
is the freedom you get in your role.

So when I was joining, I
thought that as I sale,

I would have a particular
set of responsibilities,

and the days will be
similar to each other.

But you decide what is
your vision for the year.
- There's so many areas of opportunity.
It's almost unlimited.

- I'm really proud of the
moment where I had a project
that I felt was needed in the company.
I wrote up this narrative, this document,

and it's got sent up
the chain to leadership.

It's now an actual tool
that we use internally.
So that's a really cool thing to have done
as a graduate and early stage career.

- It's not that you need
a specific set of skills.

Everyone, they bring
their own unique skills
for our customers.
- My proudest moment in AWS

was when I was working
closely with the NASA team
on the Mars Rover tech challenge.

And I was responsible for
the all physics of the robot

and the simulation and the
Mars environment itself.

It was launched at the
re:Invent across 85 countries.
It was really, really cool.
- We do the impossible a lot here.
It's kind of like you get the feeling
of about to jump off a bungee jump.

You get that feeling of like,
"Oh, what if it goes wrong?"

But you kind of know that
you've got the wire there,
because you're allowed to take risks.

- I think diversity is
very important for me.
And diversity comes into different areas.

The diversity we have from
the products and services,
and the diversity we have from our people.

We have so many different
skills, experience,

and perspective now
that is very enriching.

- So I'm quite passionate
about sustainability,

and I feel like technology can
really help move the needle
in that space.
So I got the freedom to run an initiative
to find partner companies,

to create flywheels in
which we can work together
to achieve that with the cloud.
So I'm really excited about that.

- You can decide where
you want to go in AWS.

There's so many different
routes that you can take.
You can even come up with a whole new path
and get that supported in AWS as well.

- If you want to work
with the latest tech,

and you like innovation
and like to be hands on
with whatever is latest in the market,
that's the perfect place to be.
(upbeat music)
